name: viva-connections-toolkit
description: SharePoint Framework Toolkit aims to boost your productivity in developing and managing SharePoint Framework solutions helping at every stage of your development flow, from setting up your development workspace to deploying a solution straight to your tenant without the need to leave VS Code and now even create a CI/CD pipeline to introduce automate deployment of your app. This toolkit is provided by the community.

chatParticipants.name: spfx
chatParticipants.description: How can I help you with SPFx development? Use /setup, /new, /manage, /code commands for job specific support.

commands.name: setup
commands.description: Prepare your local workspace for SharePoint Framework development

commands.name: new
commands.description: Create a new SharePoint Framework project

languageModelTools.name: spo_app_list
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Lists apps from the tenant app catalog. This tool may be used to list all apps from the tenant app catalog.
languageModelTools.userDescription: Lists apps from the tenant app catalog

languageModelTools.name: spo_app_install
languageModelTools.displayName: Install a SharePoint app in a site
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Installs an app from tenant app catalog in the site. This tool may be used to install a specified app by its GUID to a specified site.
languageModelTools.userDescription: Installs an app from tenant app catalog in the site

siteUrl.description: URL of the site. This option is required.

id.description: GUID of the app to install. This option is required.

languageModelTools.name: spo_list_add
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Creates list in the specified site. This tool may be used to create a SharePoint list in a site.
languageModelTools.userDescription: Creates list in the specified site.

title.description: Title of the list to add. This option is required.

webUrl.description: URL of the site where the list should be added. This option is required.

baseTemplate.description: The list definition type on which the list is based. Allowed values Announcements, Contacts, CustomGrid, DataSources,DiscussionBoard, DocumentLibrary, Events, GanttTasks, GenericList, IssuesTracking, Links, NoCodeWorkflows,PictureLibrary, Survey, Tasks, WebPageLibrary, WorkflowHistory, WorkflowProcess, XmlForm. Default value is GenericList. This option is optional.

description.description: The description for the list. This option is optional.

languageModelTools.name: spo_list_get
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Gets information about the specific list. This tool may be used to check if a list on a SharePoint site exists or to retrieve more information about it.
languageModelTools.userDescription: Gets information about the specific list.

title.description: Title of the list to retrieve information for. This option is required.

webUrl.description: URL of the site where the list to retrieve is located. This option is required.

languageModelTools.name: spo_list_remove
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Removes the specified list. This tool may be used to remove a SharePoint list from a site.

title.description: Title of the list to remove. This option is required.

webUrl.description: URL of the site where the list to remove is located. This option is required.

languageModelTools.name: spo_page_add
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Creates a page. This tool may be used to add a page on a SharePoint site.

name.description: Name of the page to create. This option is required.

webUrl.description: URL of the site where the page should be created. This option is required.

title.description: Title of the page to create. If not specified, will use the page name as its title. This option is optional.

layoutType.description: Layout of the page. Allowed values Article, Home, SingleWebPartAppPage, RepostPage, HeaderlessSearchResults, Spaces, Topic. Default Article. This option is optional.

languageModelTools.name: spo_site_add
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Create a new SharePoint Online site. This tool may be used to create a CommunicationSite or a TeamSite. in case of TeamSite we need to provide the owners of the site and in case of CommunicationSite we need to specify the url.
languageModelTools.userDescription: Create a new SharePoint Online site.

type.description: Type of sites to add. Allowed values TeamSite, CommunicationSite. This property is required.

title.description: Site title. This property is required.

url.description: Site URL. In case of CommunicationSite this option is required.

description.description: Site description. This property is optional.

owners.description: Comma-separated list of user emails to set as site owners. In case of TeamSite this option is required.

languageModelTools.name: spo_site_remove
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Remove a SharePoint Online site. This tool may be used to remove a site.

url.description: URL of the site. This option is required.

languageModelTools.name: spo_site_get
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Get a SharePoint Online site. This tool may be used to check if a site extist or to retrieve more information about a SharePoints site.

url.description: URL of the site. This option is required.

walkthroughs.title: SharePoint Framework Toolkit Introduction
walkthroughs.description: Start your journey wih SharePoint Framework and learn how to boost your productivity in developing and managing SharePoint Framework solutions.

steps.title: Introduction to SharePoint Framework
steps.description:
Learn SharePoint Framework and set up your Microsoft 365 tenant 
[Join the Microsoft 365 Developer Program](https://developer.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/dev-program)

steps.title: Validate your local workspace
steps.description:
Validate if your local workspace is ready for SharePoint Framework development by checking and installing the required dependencies. 
[Check dependencies](command:spfx-toolkit.checkDependencies)

steps.title: Create new project
steps.description:
Use the scaffolding form to create a new project or use one of the existing samples to kick off a new project and boost your development.
[Create a new project](command:spfx-toolkit.createProject)
[View samples](command:spfx-toolkit.samplesGallery)

steps.title: Sign in to Microsoft 365
steps.description:
Retrieve tenant helpful information and Manage your SPFx projects. 
Sign in to your tenant to get started. 
[Sign in to Microsoft 365](command:spfx-toolkit.login)

steps.title: Gulp tasks
steps.description: Get to know the Gulp tasks that are available in your SharePoint Framework project

steps.title: Boost your development with actions
steps.description:
Reduce the amount of context switching and automate your work with Actions. 
Validate your project, rename your solution, deploy it to any app catalog, grant API permissions ... and many more all without leaving the context of your work.

steps.title: Write code faster with coding snippets
steps.description: Write more with less using coding snippets

steps.title: Create a CI/CD workflow for your SPFx project
steps.description:
Create a GitHub Workflow or Azure DevOps pipeline to bundle, package, and deploy your SharePoint Framework project to any App Catalog. 
[Generate CI/CD workflow](command:spfx-toolkit.pipeline)

steps.title: Continue your learning and get additional tooling
steps.description: SharePoint Framework Toolkit is your single point to get to the official Microsoft documentation and learning regarding SharePoint Framework and additional tooling that will help you create apps for Microsoft 365.

steps.title: Connect with the Microsoft 365 and Power Platform community
steps.description:
Stay up to date and connected. 
Visit the [Microsoft 365 and Power Platform community](https://pnp.github.io/) to get more learning materials, guidance, tooling, and engage in community calls. 
Join the [community Discord server](https://aka.ms/community/discord) to stay connected and help out others. 
 Sharing is caring!

spfx-toolkit.nodeVersionManager.title: Node.js Version Manager
spfx-toolkit.nodeVersionManager.description: Choose your preferred Node.js version manager. Choose between `nvs`, `nvm`, or `none`.

spfx-toolkit.showServiceIncidentList.title: Show service health incidents
spfx-toolkit.showServiceIncidentList.description: Show the service health incidents in the account view.

spfx-toolkit.showAppsInAppCatalogs.title: Show apps in app catalogs
spfx-toolkit.showAppsInAppCatalogs.description: When set it will load all apps in every app catalog from your tenant.

spfx-toolkit.createNodeVersionFileDefaul.title: Default value for the Node version file option
spfx-toolkit.createNodeVersionFileDefaul.description: The default value for the new project's setting for creating the Node version file. If checked the default selected value will be YES.

spfx-toolkit.nodeVersionManagerFile.title: Node version manager file to be used
spfx-toolkit.nodeVersionManagerFile.description: The file to be used to store the Node version for the selected Node version manager. Remember that the .node-version file is supported only while using nvs.

spfx-toolkit.projectUpgradeOutputMode.title: Project upgrade output mode
spfx-toolkit.projectUpgradeOutputMode.description: Choose the output mode for the project upgrade. You can choose between `both`, `markdown`, or `code tour`.

spfx-toolkit.projectValidateOutputMode.title: Project validate output mode
spfx-toolkit.projectValidateOutputMode.description: Choose the output mode for the project validation. You can choose between `both`, `markdown`, or `code tour`.

viewsWelcome.contents:
Welcome to SharePoint Framework Toolkit


To start create a new SharePoint Framework project. 
[Create a new project](command:spfx-toolkit.createProject)





Use a sample to kick off a new project and boost your development.
[View samples](command:spfx-toolkit.samplesGallery)





You can also open an existing app.
[Open folder](command:vscode.openFolder)





Validate your local workspace and check if you have the required dependencies.
[Check dependencies](command:spfx-toolkit.checkDependencies)





Install the required dependencies.
[Install dependencies](command:spfx-toolkit.installDependencies)



Learn more about SharePoint Framework and this toolkit.
[Walkthrough](command:spfx-toolkit.welcome)



Start effortlessly with GitHub Copilot. Get SPFx tailored support in setting up your local workspace, creating a new project, or managing your tenant.
[Use @SPFx in GitHib Copilot](command:spfx-toolkit.openCopilot) 





For additional help or resources visit the [extension wiki](https://github.com/pnp/vscode-viva/wiki).

scripts.package: npm run clean && npm run package:ext && npm run package:webview
